instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I have a board I was working on and noticed what seems to be the first issue. I have no voltages on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>. My strategy was to look in the schematics and search for a chip it was the output on. I have gone through the schematics many times and must be missing it. The closest chip I found was <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> on page 54 of the schematic, but that does not seem to clearly indicate that is the source. I see lots lines with <SIGNAL>PP3V2_S5</SIGNAL> as the prefix. But none with just <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> by its self. Could you help me understand what all of the other versions of pp3v3_s5_**** mean? I am just looking for a basic understanding in general. Also, where exactly is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> come from?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> comes out from L7220 and is controlled by <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.
First of all check resistance to ground on that coil; dioe mode, red probe to ground.
Post voltage for <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, pins 3, 6, 8, 13, 16, 17.

Do you get Magsafe light?
Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
How come when I do a search for L7220 in the schematic or brd I am not getting any results? My PPBUS is 8.6v and, I am getting 3.42v on pp3v42. I do get magsafe light

I will check those other ones when I get to the shop.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Ooops, this is 00165 board...
So read <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> instead of <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.
Obviously the coil is L7520.
And the pins of interest (<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>) are 12, 13, 22, 23, 29.

Sorry, I was looking wrong schematic, as I have more than 10 opened in Adobe reader...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: thanks for helping me work through this. I am not sure why, but I am now getting <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
